New Records: Glenn Maxwell scored the fastest Cricket World Cup hundred
Key Match Events: Glenn Maxwell hit nine fours and eight sixes to score 106 runs off only 44 balls
Adam Zampa picked four wickets for eight runs in three overs
Glenn Maxwell's 106 runs off 44 balls is the fastest ever at the Cricket World Cup
The Netherlands was bowled out for a paltry 90 runs in 21 overs
Post-Match Reflections: Glenn Maxwell was named player of the match and said he was just trying to give his team a good platform
Glenn Maxwell said it was nice to get some rhythm in the tournament and that they have got momentum as a team
David Warner said he was proud of the team's resilience after a close win
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mitchell Marsh holed out for nine runs early
Warner and Smith stitched together 132 runs for the second wicket
Labuschagne added 84 off 76 balls with Warner
Warner was out caught right after his century
Bas de Leede picked two wickets, but Maxwell's arrival caused a significant impact
Mitchell Starc picked his 56th World Cup wicket when he bowled Max Odowd for six
Zampa finished with his third consecutive four-for
Van Beek was caught behind off Zampa, while van der Merwe was out lbw for a golden duck
